Spring Fest, IIT Kharagpur & OnePlus in association with The Storygraphers presents SFM - the short film-making competition.

Make a short film on any one of the following themes:
1. The Quest 
2. Madness
3. Superhero
and submit your entries at filmfestival.sf18@gmail.com. The film can be of any genre (comedy, film noir, romance, horror, action, etc.), the idea is to be creative with the themes and come up with a great story!

Deadline: 26th of January.

Win a total cash prize of INR 15 000, a complete fee waiver at workshops organised by The Storygraphers and a chance to feature in one of their short films.

Register at: www.springfest.in

#SpringFest2018

Spring Fest, IIT Kharagpur and MRF Tyres present the first act of our Global Music Festival - Oskar Stenmark from Sweden in association with Sweden in India. 
The musician specializes in trumpet and flugelhorn, is also a composer and educator in brass instruments. Oskar has done a number of shows in New York & Europe and now plans to come all the way to India to amaze the crowd of Spring Fest 2018.

Stay tuned as Spring Fest unfolds its Global Music Festival, announcing more international musical acts.

#GlobalMusicFestival

Spring Fest, IIT Kharagpur and WBSEDCL (Govt. of West Bengal Enterprise) presents A Mighty Pen, a journalism-based event in association with Kolkata Bloggers and Write India Publishers.

Pen down your thoughts to bring about a change in society and shape perspectives. Prizes up for grabs include a Cash Prize of INR 10,000 and an additional chance to avail:
1. Internship opportunities from the Kolkata Bloggers
2. Certification and a course on journalism from Write India Publishers with a wall frame as prize and award

For more details head over to https://springfest.in/AMightyPen.pdf
Submission deadline: 10th January 2018
Register at: https://springfest.in
Design: Kushagra Ramnani

message:
Spring Fest,the annual social and cultural fest of IIT Kharagpur is always one of the most awaited events for youngsters all across the nation. During the 3 days of the fest we immerse ourselves in the fun and frolic letting go of all the worries of our mundane lives. As the final countdown to the 59th edition of the fest to be held from 26th to 28nd of January, 2018 begins, we present to you the official aftermovie of the previous edition.

 So as you go through the glimpses of Spring Fest 2017- Bollywood Boulevard, mark your calendars,make your plans and get ready for Spring Fest 2018 as we begin the countdown for this edition being only 30 days away!

Register yourself at https://springfest.in/

#30DaysLeft
#SpringFest2018
#AfterMovie_BollywoodBoulevard

As you click some amazing pictures, we bring you a competition where you can showcase your amazing clicks along with a chance to win prizes worth INR 10,000 along with exciting goodies from OnePlus!

Spring Fest in association with OnePlus presents "Roti, Rasta aur India - An Online Street Food Photography Competition." Send us the picture of the most lip-smacking piece of food you came across this winter.

Send the picture to foodfestival.sf18@gmail.com with the following details:
1. Name
2. Phone Number
3. College Name
4.Name of the street food which is in the picture

Judging will be done on the basis of the picture getting the most number of likes, shares, and comments. 
P.S. Pictures with Love and Wow react will get brownie points. 

Deadline: 5th January 2018 11:59 PM

Yo Guwahati!

The final destination in our trip to find the next rock sensation, we move to Guwahati to conduct the prelims for Wildfire, India's oldest and largest rock band competition. Wildfire having a cash prize of INR 1,00,000 and prizes worth INR 5,00,000 which includes recording deals, gigs, showcases, scholarships and gifts offers more than what one can can ask for.

We will be waiting for all you rock enthusiasts at Topaz 2.0
Interested bands can register at: springfest.in/wildfire

See you there!

Spring Fest, IIT Kharagpur in association with LVDS and Terence Lewis Professional Training Institute is back with its solo dance competition, Shake a Leg. 
Send in your online video entries for the preliminary round to dance.sf18@gmail.com.
Cash prize worth INR 15,000 and scholarships worth 1.5 Lakhs to be won. 
Registrations open until 30th December 2017.

Details regarding the video entry:
1. Subject of the mail should be 'Shake a Leg Online Prelims'
2. Mail body should contain the name, phone number and college name of the participant.
3. Send the video in MP4 or similar format ( youtube links are not allowed).

Yo Delhi!

Next on our trip to find the next rock sensation, we move to our nation's capital Delhi to conduct the prelims for Wildfire, India's oldest and largest rock band competition. Wildfire having a cash prize of INR 1,00,000 and prizes worth INR 5,00,000 which includes recording deals, gigs, showcases, scholarships and gifts offers more than what one can can ask for.

We will be waiting for all you rock enthusiasts at DLF CyberHub on 10th December from 3PM.

Interested bands can register at: springfest.in/wildfire

See you there!

Spring Fest, IIT Kharagpur in association with the Shankar Mahadevan Academy is back with its solo singing competition, SF Idol. 
Send in your online entries for the preliminary round to https://www.shankarmahadevanacademy.com/contest/springfest18/
Cash prize worth INR 15,000 is up for grabs. Get discovered through your music, as selected top 20 finalists will battle it out for a chance to sing and interact with Mr. Shankar Mahadevan himself.
Registrations open until 2nd January, 2018.

story: Spring Fest, IIT Kharagpur added 17 new photos — with Yashi Mishra and 13 others.
message:
Spring Fest, IIT Kharagpur introduced 'HitchHike: The Eliminations' for the first time in three cities namely Kolkata, Bhubaneswar and Ranchi for Poetry Slam and Hilarity Ensues. 
We would like to congratulate all the winners who will be notified by our team. All the selected would be invited to compete at the final round of these events at IIT Kharagpur.

We would like to give a special mention to the top 3 of each of the event, who will be getting special goodies from our side!

POETRY SLAM
Bhubaneswar: Utkarsh, Abhilash, Srijan
Ranchi: Sharique khan, Naina Pandey, Syed Shabbir Ahmad
Kolkata: Sayan mondal, Deblina Chakraborty, Kumar shubham

HILARITY ENSUES
Bhubaneswar: Pujan, Mrudul, Sreenath
Ranchi: Sundeep, Vandana Rani, Anmol Gaurav
Kolkata: Anish kayal, Nikhil Roy, Mahek Ganeriwal

PS: The names mentioned here are the top 3. There are many who are selected but are not mentioned in this post. They will get notified via mail or by call.

#Eliminations
#SpringFest_2018

The wait for India’s oldest and most prestigious rock band competition is now over as Spring Fest, IIT Kharagpur and Nokia 8 presents Wildfire 2018 in association with Songdew, BalconyTV, The True School of Music, Jam Steady, Resonance Studios & Academy and Swarnabhoomi Academy of Music, Chennai. Wildfire, with a cash prize of INR 1,00,000 and prizes worth INR 5,00,000 has always been followed closely by all rock enthusiasts around the country. 
So, tune your guitar, clear your throat and register for Wildfire at springfest.in/wildfire .

Stay tuned to our page for further updates on the event.

This #Movember, we’ve joined hands with TheManCompany to "Show a #mo & Save a #bro".
Here's how you can participate:

1)Flaunt IT | Fake IT | Spot IT- Make the craziest mooch that you can think of and click a Black & White picture with it! You can sketch it, use a prop, use your hair, or sip a frothy milkshake. 

2) Upload it using the hashtags #SpringFest2018 #tmcimpact #mysupermooch on Instagram, Facebook or Twitter!

3) Don't forget to nominate 3 friends to see their crazy mooch ideas!

Every such entry will help The Man Company donate Rs.10 to the Cancer Society!
Also,10 entries flaunting the craziest moochs stand a chance to win free Sparks!
So, how crazy can your mooch get?

#moustache #stache #beard #beardlove #beardlife

message:

Visit https://nwp.springfest.in to register.

So the mic is open for you to set the stage on fire, don't miss it!

story: Spring Fest, IIT Kharagpur added 3 new photos.
message:
Spring Fest, IIT Kharagpur announces the its latest initiative, Hitch Hike: The Eliminations. Spring Fest will be coming to the following cities to select comedy and poetry enthusiasts for the events Hilarity Ensues and Poetry Slam. Only those who are can prove their mettle will be invited for the finals at IIT Kharagpur.

Visit https://nwp.springfest.in to register.

So the mic is open for you to set the stage on fire. See you soon!

story: Spring Fest, IIT Kharagpur added 12 new photos — with Shreyas Sonaniya and Amey Upadhyay.
message:
Hi Guys!
Spring Fest, IIT Kharagpur hitch hiked all the way to Bhopal conducted it's prelims on 6th October at Truba Institute of Engineering and Information Technology. Here are the results for the same:

Nukkad: BOL (Bhilai Institute of Technology)
SF Idol: Abuzar Khan, Vipin Chaubey, Pragya Sharma, Shriya Trivedi
Two For a Tango: Beat It group, Sachit & Himanshi
Shake A Leg: Akash Dhupe, Shivangi Sahu, Vikash Sharma

Heartiest congratulations to the winners! See at the finals here at IIT Kharagpur.
We thank The Cinematographers Photography for covering the event.

Spring Fest, IIT Kharagpur hitch hiked all the way to Bhopal conducted it's prelims on 6th October at Truba Institute of Engineering and Information Technology. Here are the results for the same:

Nukkad: BOL (Bhilai Institute of Technology)
SF Idol: Abuzar, Pragya, Satyam Gupta, Shriya Trivedi
Two For a Tango: Beat It group, Sachit & Himanshi
Shake A Leg: Akash Dhupe, Shivangi Sahu, Vikash Sharma

Heartiest congratulations to the winners! See at the finals here at IIT Kharagpur.
We thank The Cinematographers Photography for covering the event.

Greetings Freshers!
Spring Fest invites you all once again to come be a part of our tribe and join us in our journey.
Announcing selections for Design Team Members, for the first time ever.
If you think creativity is the way you share your soul with the world then make sure to be there at V3, Vikramshila on 29th October at 6pm!
#SF2k18
#DTM_Selections

story: Spring Fest, IIT Kharagpur added 18 new photos — with Kshitij Yadav.
message:
Hey All! Here we present before you some glimpses of the Delhi Leg of our Nationwide Prelims, Hitch Hike that were conducted in DLF CyberHub and saw a huge gathering. The winners had to get past a very talented and huge pool of competitors. 

The results for the Delhi prelims as follows:
Two For A Tango: Bhangra Lions, Brown Boys Bhangra
Shuffle: Taandvika
Shake A Leg: Divya Goyal, Namita, Priyanshu
Nukkad: Deshbandu College, NSIT, Amity School of Biotechnology and Aurobindo College.
SF Idol: Tlana, Karan Kumar, Devang Pandey, Jibin Abraham and Shruti Panwar

Heartiest congratulations to the winners! The competition only gets tougher from here. :D

story: Spring Fest, IIT Kharagpur added 28 new photos.
message:
This September, Spring Fest took a trip to Mumbai as part of our NationWide Prelims on the 30th at Infiniti Mall. The following teams/ participants qualify for the next round at Spring Fest, IIT Kharagpur. We thank Media House Photography for these wonderful pics!

Shuffle: Refactor Dance Crew, UFDC, Famous in Dark Crew.
Shake a Leg: Prabhakar Garg; Rohit Keshari; Pradeep Gupta.
Nukkad: Team Dramebaaz; Rajiv Gandhi Institute.
SFIdol: Kaivalya Kejkar; Akash Sawle; Jeetika Hazariwala.

A hearty congratulations to all the winners!

story: Spring Fest, IIT Kharagpur updated their cover photo.

message:
Are you stressed about the mid semester exams that did not go well? Or about someone who ridiculed you for being fat? Are you really bogged down by the problems of your daily life? Even if you are not, there are people around you who actually are. 

In our humble bid to give voice to those who prefer to keep quiet, we launch our Social Cause for Spring Fest, IIT Kharagpur 2018, 'Umang' on the occasion of World Mental Health Day.

You can join us in our cause for mental health and show support by adding our ‘Umang’ frame to your profile picture. You can send us your experiences and suggestions at https://2018.social.springfest.in .

Come let us not ignore this stigma anymore but stand up to it and join our hands in this campaign for creating a beautiful world with beautiful minds!

#StandUpToStigma #Umang #SpringFest2018

Design Credits: Richik Raha
Videography: Parag Mhaiske, Pranay Narayankar, Akshay Choudhary
Content: Ankurjyoti Baishya, Arghyanil Bhattacharjee

story: Spring Fest, IIT Kharagpur is with Himanshu Kushwaha.
message:
Spring Fest is coming to the "City of Lakes" for our Nationwide Prelims. The preliminary rounds for the events Nukkad, Shake a Leg, SFIdol and Two for a Tango will be conducted at Truba Institute @IncredibleTruba on 6th October in association with Mack Dance Cultural Institute and Rhythm The Musical Hunt.

Register at https://nwp.springfest.in

Register at https://nwp.springfest.in

story: Spring Fest, IIT Kharagpur added 5 new photos to the album: Engineer's Day.
message:
Engineering Students- A unique race of students who know how to procrastinate and still manage things on time. These people can survive on maggi for a semester, and won't go near the mess of a Mess.

All heroes don't wear capes. Some wear a single shirt throughout the semester.

Spring Fest, IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone a Happy Engineer's Day.

Design Credits- Dinesh Sahni

#EngineersDay
#SF2018

"Opportunities are like sunrises. If you wait too long, you miss them." 

Here we present before you the registration portal for Hitch Hike, the Nationwide Prelims of Spring Fest 2018 which will be happening in all the major cities of India this October! 

Scoot over to https://nwp.springfest.in/ to register your team and book your slots! 

Grab this opportunity and 'Hitch Hike' your way to the Finals at Spring Fest, IIT Kharagpur.

Kudos to Akash, Ankita, Atul, Neelanjan, Nilay, Nishant, Omar, Prakhar, Sandeep and Shashi for getting together our NWP Portal!

#HitchHike
#SpringFest_2018

message:
Spring Fest, IIT Kharagpur invites applications for the position of Campus Ambassador for the 59th edition of the fest. Interested to be a part of one of the biggest college festivals in the country? This is your chance! 

Spread the word about Spring Fest in your college to earn an official certificate and set yourself apart from the crowd. Loads of goodies up for grabs!!

To register yourself as a Campus Ambassador, visit https://ca.springfest.in now

With this, we introduce our final Best Campus Ambassador for Spring Fest 2017. Meet Kiran Balmiki from Xavier Institute of Social Service, Ranchi and Best CA for Eastern India.
"Thank you so much for selecting me as the best campus ambassador of the East zone. 
Working as a campus ambassador was an amazing journey for me, I enjoyed it throughout with lots of learning. 
Working in a network like this was a very different experience. It gave me confidence for initiating things and recognition for my work."- said Kiran when told about this achievement.

Meet our best Campus Ambassador from Southern India, Vivek Ranjan from GITAM University, Visakhapatnam.
"Spring Fest 2017 was like a remarkable memory in my life. I enjoyed all the funny and entertaining competitions held at IIT Kharagpur. 
I got to watch loads of talents and learned a lot from the greats who performed at IIT Kharagpur. The different kinds of competitions being organized there proved that there's no stop to creativity and innovation. 
Finally, I would like to conclude that it was a very informative and an awesome experience at IIT Kharagpur. 
Also, I am looking forward to continue visiting Spring Fest every year with my team. Thank you! 🙂"- said Vivek about his experience at Spring Fest.

Meet our best Campus Ambassador from Southern India, Vivek Ranjan from GITAM University, Visakhapatnam.
"Spring Fest 2017 was like a remarkable memory in my life. I enjoyed all the funny and entertaining competitions held at IIT Kharagpur. 
I got to watch loads of talents and learned a lot from the greats who performed at IIT Kharagpur. The different kinds of competitions being organized there proved that there's no stop to creativity and innovation. 
Finally, I would like to conclude that it was a very informative and an awesome experience at IIT Kharagpur. 
Also, I am looking forward to continue visiting Spring Fest every year with my team. Thank you! 🙂"- said Vivek about his experience at Spring Fest.

Next in line, we introduce Riya Rastogi from Dyal Singh College, New Delhi and Best Campus Ambassador for Northern India.

Here's what she says about her experience- 
"I have been a part of SF for the last two years and it has always been a memorable journey for me and my team. 
Chosen as a CA built a responsibility for keeping the team together. Full day hard work in competitions, fun in the star-nights and long night walks were the best moments for us. 
The hospitality provided by SF team and freedom allowed by IIT KGP administration just adds up to the fun.The time we spent there has always been  the best memories that remind us of the bond we have as a team."
